messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
>
> On 10/29/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
> >
> > > But drive my design with tests? That's dangerous and can potentially
> > lead to
> > > micro-design, i.e. design without seeing the big picture ("I'll use
> this
> > > signature because the test looks cleaner then").
> >
> > I notice that Joakim wrote "guide" and Cedric read "drive". As far as I
> > know, those words have nonoverlapping meanings.
>
> True, but it's called TDD, and not TGD, right? :-)
>
> I can go with "Test-Driven Development", but "Test-Driven Design" sounds
> very dangerous to me.

The tests don't actually drive, Cedric. I always drive. The difference
is that I write tests to try out my design decisions as I go. Did you
expect it to be any different?

That said, I propose that one can derive the entire body of OOD theory
armed with nothing more than the four principles of simple design
(Passes Tests, Minimizes Duplication, Communicates Well, Minimizes
Complexity). I have a proof, but the margin is too small to contain it.
